meanings.definition: Resembling clay in texture or consistency.
meanings.sent1: The wet sand at the beach felt claylike under my feet.
meanings.sent2: The potter molded the claylike material into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent3: The claylike mud on the trail made it tricky for hikers to walk without slipping.
meanings.sent4: Her skin felt claylike after spending hours in the sun without sunscreen.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands moved with a claylike precision as he sculpted the figure.

meanings.sent1: The new building material was lightweight and claylike in appearance.
meanings.sent2: The cake batter had a claylike consistency before baking.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's attempt at pottery resulted in a claylike mess all over the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises were as malleable and claylike as his character.
meanings.sent5: The scientist discovered a new substance with claylike properties in the lab.
